Reviews.Title: “Nice, brightly colored hotel”
Reviews.Author: PHeliks
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hacienda Maria Bonita for a week and a half on our trip to the Yucatan. The location for our purposes was excellent since we spent half of our vacation exploring the Mayan ruins in the nearby area as daytrips from PdC and the other half relaxing at the beach. The hotel is close to the bus terminal and also only a couple of hundred meters from the beach. Naturally, if you only want to stay at the beach, then a hotel with a seaside location would be better. But then again, there it is all touristy. (Well, in fact PdC is a town build for tourists, but from HMB for an example the taquerías with a mostly Mexican clientele are a bit closer.) The hotel was clean and atmosperic with its brightly colored walls and decorations. We ourselves also found the hotel peaceful, although a couple who stayed at the part of the hotel that is next to a night club claimed for the noise. Our room faced the street and we didn´t have any disturbance at all. The courtyard of the hotel was also a nice, serene place for relaxing and having a snack. All in all Hacienda Maria Bonita was a good experience for us and we will definitely go there again next time, when we visit Yucatan. I hope it won´t take too long, because the peninsula is the most amazing destination we have been to on our travels.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place in the Caribbean”
Reviews.Author: softy57
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Playa 4 times and in the Caribbean on 10 other occasions and this was the worst place ever. Dark halls,black mold on walls,horrible smell and noise all night. We both have athsma & left after 1 night. In fact I booked another hotel that night but they had no room till next day. Because I would not take another room, I had to pay the whole 6 nts. though I disputed with my Credit card co. Manager talked to me on phone, agreed to meet next day, didn't show, phone again, he must know it's a dump. It was a hard lesson...but I need to breathe, & the one nt. there I used rescue inhaler 4 times.Only people under 25 who party all night could deal with this.

Reviews.Title: “good quality for price”
Reviews.Author: capong
Reviews.Content: nice small hotel, clean and very friendly. All of the staff was helpfull/willling to provide hints and tips of the area. Will be back one day

Reviews.Title: “Understated and brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Piglaretta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of June, it was supposed to be for one night but we kept adding days. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable. The staff are friendly. Located right on 5th avenue - can be a little noisy at night but didn't cause us any trouble! Would definitely recommend for people travelling through and on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Stink bathroom but perfect location for budget travel”
Reviews.Author: indie_dive
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is strategic for budget trip. We stayed there on our last days in Playa Del Carmen. The hotel is closed by to good restaurants (and NOT as expensive as those in fifth avenue), scuba diving operators, pubs, bank (atm) and small supermarket Oxxo. It only takes you less than 5 minutes walking to the beach and fifth avenue. The breakfast was okay - nothing spectacular. No wi-fi in the room. The swimming pool is very small. The hotel has very friendly front office staff. We had an issue with the bathroom in our room - it was so stink. We made a complaint and it seemed that they could not do much with the smell. Since we stayed there only for 3 nights on our last holidays and already paid in advance then we tried to cope with it.

Reviews.Title: “Sounds like in the toilets of a night club!”
Reviews.Author: Archimedesrules
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is very well located, within 5 mn from everything - shops, beach, bars, restaurants etc. Yes the rooms are relatively clean, spacious, looking pretty much like on the website. The staff was helpful but nothing extravagant. The pool is small but eh, one of the nicest beaches in the world lies a 200 meters away. There is only one reason why I would never, ever come back to this hotel: the infernal noise you get at night. Althought we had paid in advance for a full week, we gave up after 3 completely sleepless nights and headed for another hotel. That was after trying to change rooms twice. The whole building is adjacent to a night club that plays techno music from 10.45 PM to 6.20 AM (the volume clearly increases after 3AM) - guess why I am so precise on the hours... I usually have a relatively heavy sleep, but I could feel the vibrations from the bass through the bed - maybe the concrete bed frame didn't help either. Apart from that, you get that standard mildew smell, maybe a bit stronger than elsewhere, but I could have lived with that. You also get very hard beds and a noisy A/C. If you plan to party non-stop then it might be worth a look - although I have heard of better deals elsewhere in the center of Playa. In short, it is quite pricey for what you get and I absolutely do not recommend this place. We ended up finding a much nicer place one block away, silent, cleaner, for 2/3 of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great find for my vacation”
Reviews.Author: dmlandis
Reviews.Content: This was a fine place to stay. Rooms are tastefully decorated with colorful tile, air conditioning that works, and cable equipped t.v. Nice balcony that overlooks pool. Pool is small but clean and refreshing after day in sun. Location is great - 1 block from 5ta avenida and next to a restaurant. Internet access in lobby. Staff was very time helpful and made me feel welcome. Would definitely stay here again - next time in Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “Best you can get for the price”
Reviews.Author: purpleskirt
Reviews.Content: I went with my bf in a budget as we were backpacking Mexico and compared between 5 different hotels, including the ones Lonely Planet advices. This was the 3rd hotel we saw and came back to stay. I think it was definitely way more worth than others because of the price and the service. I would recommend it for a family, group of friends and couples. The only problem is that it can be packed as when we left there was people waiting to see if they could get a room already. It is not right away in front of the beach but everything is walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: basildogpuppy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location. A block off fifth street and two blocks from the beach !! The hotel is cute from the outside. The pool and patio area are small and cute, do not stay here if you are looking for pool time, this is not the hotel for you. The rooms are spacious with tv's with quite a few English speaking channels and wonderful AC and ceiling fans. Although their was quite a smell of mildew and cigarets in our room. The bathrooms are nice with showers with wonderful water pressure and temperatures. The bed and the sheets where adequate, and the pillows, well adequate is being polite. The hotel staff was extremely helpful, nice and accommodating. The hotel is feet away from Coco Bongo, which you can hear the music playing on weekends until early on in the morning. If you are not partying with them ear plugs are a most. We had flight issues on the way down, they would not let us cancel one night of our reservations, we had to pay for the night we where not their. Something that is understandable in a small hotel, but on a busy weekend night and us still staying three more nights it would have been nice if they could have worked with us on the situation. This was an ok hotel for the money, but we have stayed in nicer places for less money in Playa, if you can I would shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Terrible Smell!”
Reviews.Author: VDBurg
Reviews.Content: Cute little hotel - looked just like the pictures on their website. The location is just perfect. It's only a two minute walk to the beach and the main pedestrian area is just around the corner. Also, some fabulous restaraunts are really close. I've been to Mexico a few times, and I'm familiar with the musty smell and hard beds, and I get a little peeved when people complain about them, because it's just a regular part of a Mexico trip. But this smell was horrible! We tried to turn up the A/C to get the humidity out, but there was mildew that you could see right in the walls. Also, the beds were so hard that our hips hurt! Every time we walked in the room, the smell was outrageous. When we got home and opened up our suitcases, the clothes smelled! We had to put every single thing in the washer. Too bad, because I really liked everything else. But I could never go back there. Also, their website said they had a free continental breakfast or American breakfast for $3.99. This is not true as their restaurant is under construction.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Lufternurk
Reviews.Content: I was a littlebit afraid to book this hotel but on the spot - no reason. Hotel was nice - spacious rooms, nice balcony, clean bathroom, fridge, TV. And great location! About noise - maybe there was something from nearby club, but in generally our room - beside courtyard, was very quiet. You cant wait too much for this price (ca 63$/night), but price/quality level is IMHO certainly good!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean but noisy”
Reviews.Author: wekkuli
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean and staff was very helpful. However, it was impossible to sleep without earplugs because of the noisy music from the bar in the same block. The bass tunes were echoing in the whole building all night. The room was ok and there was hot water in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience by far”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel to stay at. Lost reservations,very rude receptionist. Noisy only when your sleeping or trying to sleep. (they don't tell you there is a band that plays underneath the hotel from 10pm to 5am.)shakes the hotel walls. No hot water and pressure most of the time, toilets don't flush properly, Very pricy for what you get($85. U.S a night)Very disappointed, ruined vaction at that point, never come back there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in August and was extremely happy with my stay. The hotel and rooms were of a very good standard and the staff were so helpful. The location is great and there are a couple of excellent restaurants just around the corner-Hemmingways and also one just across the street(the name escapes me) both serving Mexican cuisine for a reasonable price. I would stay here again and may do so as I am returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & Quaint, However...”
Reviews.Author: bkisl8
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with this hacienda from our first view of it. From the outside, it truly is lovely, with its arched gate entry showing a tantalizing peak of the interior courtyard. Picture book old Mexico. However our room was not as picture perfect. We turned on the room air conditioner and 2 hrs later, the room was an oven. The air conditioner was putting out hotter air than most heaters. After 2 attempts to fix it, we turned it off. There was a sliding door to the balconey and opening it did cool the stifling room, but also brought in all of the street noise. Another minor inconvenience was that we could not get hot water in the bathroom sink. However the shower did work well. But the absolute worst feature of the room was the king bed. Sleeping on it was pretty similar to laying a sheet on top of concrete...unfortunately a VERY accurate description. Overall, it was a hotel we would admire from the outside, and take a picture of, but there are many lovely hotels in Playa del Carmen. We would try one of them the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Could be suite...”
Reviews.Author: kyshel
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay one more night in MX so booked hotel thru Spa Palace desk (they were full--WAAAAH). Got basic room for $80--sunken double beds, MUSTY, so-so bath on first floor. Disappointed so we went for a drink. Came back and asked about better room--they said they could give us a suite for $16 more, so I grabbed it. Well, lemme tell ya!! Aside from some toilet problems it was a gem!! They only have one room like this and it's on the brochure--too cool. Kinda like the Flintstone's vacationed in MX. Entry with small sitting area+balcony, large BR with king Bed(hard as a rock--no pun....) table and chairs, fridge (remember to plug it in!!) beamed ceiling, stucco with funky paint and tiled bath/shower +jacuzzi tub (window, candle, rocks) painted sinks. Very fun and what I like to think of as "vacation hacienda". I loved it. Pool is very small so only plan for a few days--maybe transition to try the "town" feeling--I prefer all-inclusives 4+stars for other stays but would go back a day or so again. Remember--there's only ONE suite.

Reviews.Title: “our private hideaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This a beautiful little Hacienda quiet and privatley enclosed. We stayed 11 nights and hated to leave. Very clean cute little pool close to ave. 5 and helpful staff though they speak little english if any for some. If you like simple private places this is for you.

HotelInfo.Name: Hacienda Maria Bonita
HotelInfo.Address: Avenue 10N, 215 between 10 y 12, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
